lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "(sighs) "It has been quite a while "since I've taken just a moment "to relax, I suppose."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, "should you come across any more of those cupcakes--"

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does the door do the thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right." (laughter) She seems very distracted and is trying to piece together incongruent events, but waves a hand and the door closes behind (thuds).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's get the fuck out of here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go, let's keep going, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather your things and rapidly follow the very insistent Jester back into now the night shadows of the swamp ahead of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still exhausted, still recovering from the initial journey, you briskly vanish into the shadows of night.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, hey, hey, wait, wait, wait!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you make your way into the deep mists, we're going to end tonight's session there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well no, but she has advantage on magic resistance, "so it's just a roll," and still a fail.

lines.text: You completely fucking Gretel-ed his Hansel, like it was just--

lines.text: Oh my god, you fed a witch a baked good, how?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For every Inflict Wounds that has failed, that your dice have failed you on-- That was payback.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would've started a war again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beau was about to just walk away from everything.

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: No, made up my mind, so still processing.

lines.text: World War III or a Hostess cupcake (laughs).

lines.text: Matt: A very long-living, very intelligent and conniving individual that has made their living feeding off the misery of other people that she's tricked them into--

lines.text: Matt: But we'll pick this up, next Thursday!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a dungeon master, that was one of the more frustrating moments, like as a person that's built to an intense encounter like this, and one of the most proud I've been of a player outsmarting me.

lines.text: It was cool, though, because we could see your, like, vague disappointment of like, "No, this is my big-- no, I'm leaning into this."

lines.text: Cards there, just in case somebody wanted to go ahead and get a reading based on them wanting something and making an exchange like Thoreau did.
